title: Egyptian font style #2
content:
Another font I am unsure about.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102627im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-10-05%20at%207_4671.19.40%20PM.png)

| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2014-10-05 at 7.19.40 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102627/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202014-10-05%20at%207.19.40%20PM.png) | 46.48 KB |
author: kvnrangel

comments.content:
Looks like old time poster lettering.  
The letter-forms are similar to Quaint Gothic from the Dickinson Type Foundry in Boston USA circa 1900. Also known as Desdemona by the K.K. Hof & K. Brendler Foundry.  
Digital Quaint Gothic SG [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/quaint-gothic-sg/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102627/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/quaint-gothic-sg/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/quaint-gothic-sg/")  
Also Desdemona Black [http://www.will-harris.com/store-h/desdemona.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102627/http:/www.will-harris.com/store-h/desdemona.html "http://www.will-harris.com/store-h/desdemona.html")  
Don

The shape of letters is also similar to Revue: [http://www.myfonts.com/search/revue/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141009102627/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/revue/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/revue/")

Do you have an approximate date for the poster or advert?  
Don
Appreciate all of this information. Don , I do not have an approximate date for this sample unfortunately but these recommendations are a big help. Thanks.
